page.title: 07REDMARLEY 50 YEARS AGO ONE
page.content: Kate Brazington came to Redmarley in 1939.In those days there was no mains electricity.A van came from Gloucester with paraffin for the lamps,cookers and heaters.There was no mains water so the village well was very important Some cottages had their own wells. It was a common sight to see people with a yoke on their shoulders carrying buckets.There was no mains sanitation. Some houses had cess-pits,but most had a bucket toilet. Waste water was put on gardens. Farming was very different and a lot of the work was done with horses.Hay- making and harvesting was a family affair.Everyone had a job and meals were eaten in the fields.It was a very happy time though at the end of the day everyone was tired.The present playing fields were allotments strips of land were rented to cottagers
